message.content:
cs.DS, cs.NA, cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with approximation algorithms for network design problems, which are typically studied in the area of theoretical computer science. The use of spectral methods is a common technique in this area, and the paper specifically mentions spectral sparsification and discrepancy theory. Therefore, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves optimization and linear programming, which are relevant to cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) and cs.IT (Information Theory). The regret minimization framework used in the algorithm is related to online learning, which is studied in cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper mentions applications to computational geometry, which falls under cs.CG (Computational Geometry).
